page.title: 01GRIMLEY AND HALLOW
page.content: The Parish of Grimley lies about 6km north of Worcester on the west bank of the River Severn. It includes the villages of Grimley and Sinton Green and also Monkwood. The popula- tion in 1981 was 528. The village of Grimley lies close to the flood plain of the Severn. Sinton Green is about 1\kms west of Grimley. Monkwood is a short distance further west. The vill- ages are surrounded by agricultural land-mainly rough grazing. Hallow lies about 4km north of Worcester, also on the west bank of the River Severn. It is a much larger village than Grimley and straddles the A443 from Worcester to Tenbury. It possesses 2 shops including a post office, 2 garages and three public houses. The village is surrounded by agricultural land. Bevere Lock lies between Grimley and Hallow.
